name: ButtonEffect
shortDescription: Change the way a button looks based on the state of the button
description: Note: This extension requires the "ButtonFSM" extension (also called "Button States").
This is a simple yet powerful method for changing the appearance of objects that use the "Button states" behavior.
The states of a button include: idle, hover, pressed, held outside, and focused.
Multiple behaviors are provided and they can be combined to make a juicy button with animated responses to user input.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Enable and disable the effects of a button based on its state.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonEffects

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change the current animation number of a button based on its state.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonAnimationNumber

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change the current animation name of a button based on its state.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonAnimationName

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change the size scale of a button based on it's state.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonScaleTween

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly change the angle of a button based on its state.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonAngleTween

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly change the opacity of a button based on its state.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonOpacityTween

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly change the color tint of a button based on its state.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonColorTintTween
